comments.raw_text: Bug 1628835 and bug 1629670 handle interpreting and compiling regexps. The last major piece of the puzzle is calling them from Ion (and Warp).
comments.text: Bug 1628835 and bug 1629670 handle interpreting and compiling regexps. The last major piece of the puzzle is calling them from Ion (and Warp).
comments.creator: iireland@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: PrepareAndExecuteRegexp has to be updated to call the new engine. In preparation, this patch factors out a couple of helper functions that a) can be shared between the two versions, and b) make sense as standalone functions in the future when we remove the old implementation.
comments.author: iireland@mozilla.com
comments.creator: iireland@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 9140831
Bug 1630090: Refactor PrepareAndExecuteRegexp r=jandem


PrepareAndExecuteRegexp has to be updated to call the new engine. In preparation, this patch factors out a couple of helper functions that a) can be shared between the two versions, and b) make sense as standalone functions in the future when we remove the old implementation.

comments.raw_text:
The code in this patch lines up fairly closely with the old version of PrepareAndExecuteRegexp, but not so closely that I wanted to unify them, particularly since the old version will be going away. Aside from the changes to the layout of the input data, the main difference is that the return value is now being passed in a register instead of on the stack.

Depends on D71080
comments.creator: iireland@mozilla.com
comments.author: iireland@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 9140832
Bug 1630090: Implement PrepareAndExecuteRegexp for new engine r=jandem


The code in this patch lines up fairly closely with the old version of PrepareAndExecuteRegexp, but not so closely that I wanted to unify them, particularly since the old version will be going away. Aside from the changes to the layout of the input data, the main difference is that the return value is now being passed in a register instead of on the stack.

Depends on D71080
